struct.comment: Calibration parameters for this cell
struct.name: SCalibrationParameters

member.comment: This Indicates whether the functionality of calibration is Enabled or Disabled. Other IE in this structrue is valid only when calibrationEnabled = 1.
member.name: calibrationEnabled

member.comment: Calibration period, The true calibration period will be CalibrationPeriod*10ms, 10ms is duration for one LTE frame. The value should be the powers of 2. e.g 1,2,4,8...4096.
member.name: calibrationPeriod

member.comment: Defined point in time when the RX calibration starts in uplink. The offset is from downlink special subframe start boundary. Expressed in universal time units (1/40 Ts). Details of parameter value are HW specific.
member.name: rxCalibrationStartOffset

member.comment: Defined point in time when the RX calibration ends in uplink. The offset is from downlink special subframe start boundary. Expressed in universal time units (1/40 Ts). This value must be greater than rxCalibrationStartOffset. Details of parameter value are HW specific.
member.name: rxCalibrationEndOffset

member.comment: Defined point in time when the TX calibration starts in downlink. The offset is from downlink special subframe start boundary. Expressed in universal time units (1/40 Ts). Details of parameter value are HW specific.
member.name: txCalibrationStartOffset

member.comment: Defined point in time when the TX calibration ends in downlink. The offset is from downlink special subframe start boundary. Expressed in universal time units (1/40 Ts). This value must be greater than txCalibrationStartOffset. Details of parameter value are HW specific.
member.name: txCalibrationEndOffset

member.comment: Which RRU port will carry the calibration streams (calibration training sequence in RX calibration and loopbacked sample streams in TX calibration).

member.comment: Denoting calibration configuration set.

member.comment: Bit 0-1: Control Format Indicator (cfi) with value 1...3 for number of OFDM symbols to be used for transmission of PDCCHs in a subframe. This value is required for generating PCFICH. Bit 2-5: unused Bit 6: value 0: CSI RS shall be not transmitted in this subframe, value 1: CSI RS shall be transmitted in this subframe. Note, it’s valid only in a CSI RS subframe. Bit 7: value 0: non-MBSFN subframe, value 1: MBSFN subframe.

member.name: subFrameNumber

member.name: cfi

member.comment: TX power spectral density in dBm per subcarrier. Step size is 1/100 dBm.
member.name: txPower

member.comment: Resources to be used for PDSCH transmission
member.name: resources

member.comment: Transport block format
member.name: tbFormat

member.comment: Transport block size in bit
member.name: tbSize

member.comment: SRIO ID used by PHY TX for SRIO direct read to fetch PDSCH payload data from MAC
member.name: srioId

member.comment: Pointer to u8. Pointer to a variable-size data structure containing the transport block. If NULL, actual TB data is included in this message immediately after this structure (block alignment is 32-bit). If not NULL, pointer indicates the block start address. The block shall be aligned on a double word (64-bit) boundary. The client is responsible for freeing the memory, see PhyData Interface Specification for details.
member.name: tbPointer

member.comment: Bit 0: pdcchCheckFlag If it is set to true, then the transport block will only be transmitted if the PHY_PdcchSendReq of the same TTI contains allocated resources for this PDSCH send request. See LTE_UP_8429. For PMCH the flag has to be set to false. Bit 1: payloadType; value 0: PDSCH payload, value 1: PMCH payload Bit 2: TDD specific. csiRsReBlank: TRUE (for Rel10 UE with CSI-RS configured, CSI-RS RE needs to be blanked from PDSCH data RE); FALSE(for Rel8/9 UE or Rel10 UE but not configured CSI-RS, CSI-RS RE will be punctured to transmit CSI-RS). Bit 3-15: unused Bit 16-31: mbsfnRsPower (=0 in case of PDSCH payload)
member.name: tbFlags
member.rangeDescription: Bit 0: 0...1; Bit 1: 0...1; Bit 2: True...False, TDD specific; Bit 3-15: unused; Bit 16-31: -6000...+6000.

struct.comment: PrsInfo parameters for OTDOA
struct.name: SPhyPrsInfo

member.comment: Enabling and disabling PRS transmission for OTDOA. GLO_FALSE: feature disabled GLO_TRUE: feature enabled
member.name: actOtdoa

member.comment: PRS bandwidth according to parameter N_RB^PRS of 3GPP TS 36.211, Section 6.10.4. The PRS bandwidth has to be lower or equal than the configured cell bandwidth (dlChBw).
member.name: prsBandwidth
member.rangeDescription: 1,4 MHz, 3 MHz, 5 MHz, 10 MHz, 15 MHz, 20 MHz

member.comment:
Muting pattern to specify the PRS subframes to be sent with muted power as defined in TS 36.355 for prs-MutingInfo. The muting position is identified by: mute_pos(i+1) = ((prsMutingInfo>>(15-i)) & 1); i=0...prsMutingPatterLength-1
In other words: First muting position is identified by: prsMutingInfo & 0x00008000 2nd by prsMutingInfo & 0x00004000 ... where prsMutingInfoPatternLength bits are valid beginning from 1st muting position.
If the bit is set to 0, the PRS is muted in the corresponding PRS positioning occasion.
member.name: prsMutingInfo
member.rangeDescription: Depending on prsMutingInfoPatternLength l: l=0: na. else 0 ... 0x0000FFFF & (0xFFFF0000 >> prsMutingInfoPatternLength)

member.comment: Configuration of PVS transmission for the PRS signal GLO_FALSE: PRS signal will be transmitted on first antenna only. GLO_TRUE: PRS signal will be transmitted on both antennas, using Precoding Vector Switching (PVS) TX diversity mode.
member.name: actPrsTxDiv

member.comment: TX power spectral density for PRS signal in dBm per subcarrier per antenna. Step size is 1/100 dBm.
member.name: txPowerPrs

typedef.comment: 16-bite type for UE ID.
typedef.name: TUeIdI16

typedef.comment: The cyclic shift of the sounding reference signal is configured for each UE by higher layers from TSrcCyclicShift parameter which is actually index from 0 to 7 from where cyclic shift as radians is generated by UL PHY.
typedef.name: TSrsCyclicShift

typedef.comment: One byte defintion fo the cyclic shift of the sounding reference signal.
typedef.name: TSrsCyclicShiftU8

typedef.comment: Decoded 1 or 2 bit DL HARQ-ACK result, which is sent by UE to uplink. Bit value 1 means positive acknowledgement (ACK) and bit value 0 stands for negative acknowledgement (NACK).
typedef.name: TDlHarqAckBits

typedef.comment: One byte definition for the decoded 1- or 2-bit DL HARQ-ACK result, which is sent by UE to uplink. Bit value 1 means positive acknowledgement (ACK) and bit value 0 stands for negative acknowledgement (NACK). In TDD: If pucchFormat == EPucchFormat_1b_CS or harqAckType == EDlHarqAckType_Multicell then each 2 bits are used to indicate one HARQ ACK bit in one cell from LSB, as b1b0 indicate HARQ-ACK(0) b3b2 indicate HARQ-ACK(1) b5b4 indicate HARQ-ACK(2) b7b6 indicate HARQ-ACK(3) Each two bits are defined as: b(2*i+1)b(2*i) HARQ-ACK info ‘00’ ‘NACK’ ‘01’ ‘ACK’ ‘10’ ‘DTX’ ‘11’ ‘NACK/DTX’ or ‘Any’ If less than 4 HARQ-ACK bits reported, unused bits shall be filled by ‘0’s. For example, if PHY reports 2-bit HARQ ACK for one cell with the decoded bit values HARQ-ACK(0) = ‘ACK’, HARQ-ACK(1) = ‘DTX’, harqAckBits shall be 0x09.
typedef.name: TDlHarqAckBitsU8

typedef.comment: Frequency error as Hz. Frequency error is calculated from channel estimate rotation during 1 ms TTI. Static frequency error is not compensated i.e. it is include into measurement.
typedef.name: TFrequencyError

typedef.comment: Type for decoded CQI bits in the 32 bit word. Bits are packed into 32 bit words as MSB bit first. so that 3GPP defined 0-bit with value '1' goes to u32 number 0b1000 0000 0000 0000 ' 0000 0000 0000 0000. The 3GPP CQI bit number 0 goes into bit number 31 of cqi word. The 3GPP CQI bit number 31 goes into bit number 0 of cqi word. If there are less than 32 CQI bits the LSB bits of cqi word are unspecified.
typedef.name: TCqiBits

typedef.comment: CQI field size in bits. The type contains the CQI field size which consists of CQI, PMI and RI (only PUCCH) fields.
typedef.name: TCqiSize

typedef.comment: One byte definition for CQI field size in bits. The type contains the CQI field size which consists of CQI, PMI and RI (only PUCCH) fields.
typedef.name: TCqiSizeU8

typedef.comment: The interference power measurement contains the following components: Interference (I) + Noise (N). The interference power measurement is reported as milli watts (mW). The number format is IEEE-754 32-bit Single Precision floating point. power_dBm = 10*log(power_lin) 1E-14 mW corresponds -140 dBm. 0.1 mW corresponds -10 dBm.
typedef.name: TInterferencePower

typedef.comment: Noise variance measurement. The number format is IEEE-754 32-bit Single Precision floating point. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754 http://babbage.cs.qc.edu/courses/cs341/IEEE-754references.html The format is compatible with TI C6x c-compiler floating point format.
typedef.name: TNoiseVariance

typedef.comment: PRACH Preamble Index
typedef.name: TPrachIndex

typedef.comment: Preamble cyclic shift configuration. See 36.211 / 5.7.2 for further details.
typedef.name: TPrachCyclicShift

typedef.comment: Preamble format for PRACH defines the size of cyclic prefix and sequence in one access slot. See 36.211 / 5.7.1 for further details.
typedef.name: TPrachPreambleFormat

typedef.comment: Preamble timing for the PRACH channel. Value 14 is not applicable if preambleFormat==1 or 2. Values 12-14 are not applicable if preambleFormat==3. See 36.211 / 5.7.12 for further details.
typedef.name: TPrachPreambleTiming

typedef.comment: First logical RACH Root sequence number. The set of used sequence numbers is calculated in combination with cyclicShift. See 36.211 / 5.7.2 for further details.
typedef.name: TPrachRootSeqIndex

typedef.comment: Physical Resource Block Number. Unit = 12 subcarriers. Range is from 0 to 99 for 20 MHz band.
typedef.name: TPrbNumber

typedef.comment: PRACH frequency multiplexing index
typedef.name: TPreambleFra

typedef.comment: One byte definition for Physical Resource Block Number. Unit = 12 subcarriers. Range is from 0 to 99 for 20 MHz band.
typedef.name: TPrbNumberU8

typedef.comment: Resources used for transmission of PUCCH format 1a and 1b are identified by a resource index from which the orthogonal sequence index and the cyclic shift are determined. If all cyclic shifts are allowed one PRB can contain 36 indexes. In theory whole system band can be allocated for PUCCH meaning there are 100 PRBs at maximum. This means that maximum number of resurce indexes is 3600.
typedef.name: TPucchResourceIndexAn

typedef.comment: Resources used for transmission of PUCCH format 2, 2a and 2b are identified by a resource index from which the orthogonal sequence index and the cyclic shift are determined.
typedef.name: TPucchResourceIndexCqi

typedef.comment: Resources used for transmission of PUCCH format 1a and 1b are identified by a resource index from which the orthogonal sequence index and the cyclic shift are determined. If all cyclic shifts are allowed one PRB can contain 36 indexes. In theory whole system band can be allocated for PUCCH meaning there are 100 PRBs at maximum. This means that maximum number of resurce indexes is 3600.
typedef.name: TPucchResourceIndexSr

typedef.comment: Defines the type for processing load values. Unit is Imaginary CPU cycle.
typedef.name: TProcessingLoad

typedef.comment: Defines the reference signal sequence shift between PUSCH and PUCCH. See 36.211 / 5.5.1.3 for further details.
typedef.name: TUlRefSigDeltaSeqShift

typedef.comment: Defines demodulation reference signal cyclic shift cell specific index for PUSCH. See 36.211 / 5.5.2.1.1 for further details.
typedef.name: TUlRefSigParamNdmrs

typedef.comment: RI bits, Bit packing is started from LSB (bit number 0 in the word)
typedef.name: TRiData

typedef.comment: One byte definition for RI bits. In FDD, bit packing is started from LSB (bit number 0 in the byte) In TDD, bits are put into byte as MSB bit first order meaning that RI bit zero (o0 or a0 in 5.2.2.6 and 5.2.3.3 in 3GPP TS36.212) goes to bit 7. RI bit 1 (o1 or a1) goes into bit 6 and so on.
typedef.name: TRiDataU8

typedef.comment: RI field size
typedef.name: TRiSize

typedef.comment: One byte definition for RI field size in bits.
typedef.name: TRiSizeU8

typedef.comment: RSSI is the UE power over all allocated PRBs normalized for one PRB. RSSI measurement is reported as milli watts (mW). The number format is IEEE-754 32-bit Single Precision floating point. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_754 http://babbage.cs.qc.edu/courses/cs341/IEEE-754references.html The format is compatible with TI C6x c-compiler floating point format. It is possible to do calculations as fixed point and convert result floating to point for interface. rssi_dBm = 10*log(rssi) 1E-14 mW corresponds -140 dBm. 0.1 mW corresponds -10 dBm.
typedef.name: TRssi

typedef.comment: The signal power measurement contains only the own signal power (S). Interference (I) and Noise (N) powers are not included. The signal power measurement is reported as milli watts (mW). The number format is IEEE-754 32-bit Single Precision floating point. power_dBm = 10*log(power_lin) 1E-14 mW corresponds -140 dBm. 0.1 mW corresponds -10 dBm.
typedef.name: TSignalPower

typedef.comment:
SINR measurement result as linear scale multiplied with 1E-3 coefficient. sinr_lin = sinr * 1E-3 sinr_dB = 10*log(sinr_lin)
Value 1 corresponds -30 dB SINR. Value 1E9 corresponds +60 dB SINR.
typedef.name: TSinr

typedef.comment: Time offest estimate used in PUCCH and SRS timing advance measurements. Unit is 0,13 us (=0,52us/4). Values (-127,...,0,...,+127) correspond to the time offset estimate values (- 16,51 us,...,0 us,...+ 16,51 us).
typedef.name: TTimeOffsetEst

typedef.comment: Reliability of the time offset estimate used in timing advance measurements. Unit is 1/65536. Values (0,1,...,65535) correspond to the reliabilities (0,1/65536, ..., 65535/65536).
typedef.name: TTimeOffsetEstWeight

typedef.comment: Type for the imag or real part of the complex estimator Phi used in timing advance measurements. Phi value step is 1/2^31. Values (-2^31, -2^31+1,...,2^31-1) correspond to the Phi values (-1, -1+1/2^31, ..., 1-1/2^31).
typedef.name: TTimeEstPhi

typedef.comment: The total power measurement contains the following components: Signal (S) + Interference (I) + Noise (N) The total power measurement is reported as milli watts (mW). The number format is IEEE-754 32-bit Single Precision floating point. power_dBm = 10*log(power_lin) 1E-14 mW corresponds -140 dBm. 0.1 mW corresponds -10 dBm.
typedef.name: TTotalPower

typedef.comment: Type for frequency offset (FO) and FO reliability packed by PHY for storage in MAC for PRACH, PUSCH and PUCCH. FO and FO reliabilty are packed in one word by using the hexadecimal encoding. If the value is 0xaaaabbbb in hexadecimal format then 0xaaaa is the FO and 0xbbbb is the FO reliability.
typedef.name: TFrequencyOffset

typedef.comment: The sub carrier index (k) as defined in 36.211 chapter 5.2.1.
typedef.name: TSubCarrierIndex
typedef.rangeDescription: 0...12 x Number of PRBs in system band

typedef.comment: Type for elapsed time counter used together with frequency offset estimate
typedef.name: TElapsedTime

typedef.comment: In FDD: Type for numbers of two downlink HARQ processes packed in one byte by using the hexadecimal encoding. If the value is 0xab in hexadecimal format then 0xa is the DLHARQprocess#1 and 0xb is the DLHARQprocess#2. For example, DLHARQprocess#1=3 and DLHARQprocess#2=5 are encoded to 0x35. In TDD: This field defines the number of bundled DL subframes in one serving cell. Note, this parameter is in codeword basis, 4MSBs indicates the number of codeword 0, 4LSBs indicates the number of codeword 1.
typedef.name: TDlHarqProcessInfoPacked

typedef.comment: One byte definition for Number of code blocks C; according to 36.212 chapter 5.1.2
typedef.name: TNumOfCodeBlocks

typedef.comment: One byte enum definition that replaces EBundlingMode. Note: Constants in the original enum must be within the 0..255 range.
typedef.name: TEBundlingModeU8

enum-member.name: ERiQualityResult_NotAttempted

enum-member.name: ERiQualityResult_Dtx

enum-member.comment: A valid RI was detected
enum-member.name: ERiQualityResult_Tx

member.comment: This shall be set to 0 in FB12.11. The ueContextFlags; a flag used to carry information between LTE MAC PS, LTE MAC DATA and LTE UL PHY. LTE UL PHY shall transparently copy the received ueContextFlags to PHY_PuschReceiveRespU message sent to LTE MAC DATA. Values are as follows: LSB 0: A new ueIndex flag. Indicates first PUSCH reception request after a new ueIndex value has been allocated for an UE. The flag is set whenever a new ueIndex is allocated or when the value is changed. The flag is set for initial transmission only. When set, LTE UL PHY shall set to zero its internal Frequency estimation storage for this ueIndex. LSB 1: A non-contention based RA flag. Indicates reception of the first UL TB for an UE already having a permanent UE context during a non-contention based RA procedure. The flag is set similarly for initial transmission and possible retransmissions. LTE UL PHY does not use the flag (needed by LTE MAC DATA). DCM only. LSB 2: A msg3 flag. Indicates msg3 reception during contention based RA procedure. The flag is set similarly for initial transmission and possible retransmissions. LTE UL PHY shall use this flag for suspicious events logging. LSB 2 is not used in TDD. LSBs 3…7: Reserved for future use, set to 0.
member.name: ueContextFlags

member.name: ueIndex

In TDD: This field defines the number of bundled DL subframes which relates to HARQ_ACK bits and shall be used to decode the table "Table 7.3-1" on PUCCH.
member.name: harqProcessesInfoPacked

member.comment: PUCCH format
member.name: pucchFormat

member.comment: 1st CQI/PMI or RI size in bits. The parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. See Table 6 in PhyData. In FDD, supported sizes of RI are 0,1 and 2.
member.name: cqiSizeRi1

member.comment: 2nd CQI/PMI size in bits. The parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. See Table 6 in PhyData. Parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. If cqiSizeRi2=RESET_RI_TABLE, PHY shall reset the RI table to 0 in case RI is not detected for relevant UE’s serving cell. For TDD, PTI shall also be reset with value 0.
member.name: cqiSizeRi2

member.comment: Indicate CQI/PMI size in case of RI=0 and PTI=0. Valid only when cqiRepType=ECqiRepType_ambiguous. Not used in FDD. Parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. See Table 6 in PhyData.
member.name: cqiSizeRi1Pti0

member.comment: Indicate CQI/PMI size in case of RI=1 and PTI=0. Valid only when cqiRepType=ECqiRepType_ambiguous. Not used in FDD. Parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. See Table 6 in PhyData.
member.name: cqiSizeRi2Pti0

member.comment: TDD specific parameter. Serving subcell ID. Indicates the serving sub-cell which shall decode the data and perform measurements. 0 means invalid.
member.name: servingSubCellId

member.comment: TDD specific parameter. Candidate subcell ID. Indicates the candidate sub-cell which shall perform measurements. 0 means invalid.
member.name: candidateSubCellId

member.comment: PHY shall use it to decide whether RI or CQI/PMI should be decoded. Parameter is for UE’s PCell if riCqiIndicator = 0 and is for UE’s SCell if riCqiIndicator = 1. See Table 6 in PhyData.
member.name: cqiRepType

member.comment: This flag is valid only with formats 1a, 1b, and 1b with channel selection. If the flag is true Scheduling Request (SR) is scheduled simultaneously with HARQ-ACK, which requires special detection algorithms from PHY. In case of fromat 1b with channel selection, reception of spatially bundled or unbundled HARQ-ACK is to be supported according to Section 7.3 of 36.213 v10.6
member.name: srHarqAckCombined

member.comment: This flag is valid only if pucchFormat is 2, 2a or 2b. If the flag is true Scheduling Request (SR) is scheduled simultaneosly with CQI. If pucchFormat=2, PHY will detect whether UE transmitted SR on resourceIndexSr or CQI on resourceIndexCqi. PHY will include CQI and SR info in the UE response messages. If pucchFormat=2a or 2b, PHY will detect whether UE transmitted SR+HARQ ACK on resourceIndexSr or CQI +HARQ-ACK on resourceIndexCqi. PHY will include CQI, HARQ ACK, and SR info in the UE response messages.
member.name: simulSrAndCqi

member.comment: Bitfield that contains the SRS related flags for this UE for this TTI. 0th bit is to be set to indicate that PHY uses shortened formats 1/1a/1b and for format 1b with channel selection 1st bit is to be set to indicate that SRS transmission overlaps with PUCCH format 2/2a/2b PRBs. If it is set PHY will "discard" the last symbol interfered by SRS for formats 2/2a/2b. Bits 3..7 are unused and must be unset. Example 1. Value 0 = 00000000b indicates that PHY will use both the normal (not shortened) formats 1/1a/1b and the normal reception for formats 2/2a/2b. Example 2. Value 3=00000011b indicates that 1) PHY will use the shortened formats 1/1a/1b; 2) PHY will "discard" last symbol for PUCCH formats 2/2a/2b. Example 3. Value 4=00000100b is invalid. (further development and is open if it is needed 3rd bit is to be set to indicate that SRS transmission overlaps with PUCCH format 1ab PRBs...)
member.name: simultanousSrs

member.comment: This field defines HARQ-ACK resources and is used only with formats 1a/1b, 1b with channel selection or 2a/2b. In case of formats 1a/1b, or 2a/2b, only 16LSBs is valid.16 MSBs should be filled with 0. In case of format 1b with channel selection, the parameter defines the single resource or the pair of resources related to PDSCH transmission on PCell. See 10.1.2.2.1 of 36.213 V10.4 and Table 7 in PhyData. In FDD, in case of format 1b with channel selection, MAC shall set 16LSBs to PHY_INVALID_VALUE and 16MSBs to zero if the parameter is not valid. See Table 4. In TDD, in case of format 1b with channel selection, MAC shall set both 16LSBs and 16MSBs to PHY_INVALID_VALUE. See Table 5. The parameter maximum range depends on maximum number of PUCCH PRBs. This depends on many PhyCell parameters.
member.name: resourceIndexAn

member.comment: The parameter defines the single resource or the pair of resources related to PDSCH transmission on SCell signaled to UE via the TPC field in the DCI format of the corresponding PDCCH. See also 10.1.2.2.1 of 36.213 V10.4 and Table 7 in PhyData. In FDD, MAC shall set 16LSBs to PHY_INVALID_VALUE and 16MSBs to zero if the parameter is not valid. See Table 4. In TDD, MAC shall set both 16LSBs and 16MSBs to PHY_INVALID_VALUE. See Table 5.
member.name: resourceIndexAnScell

member.comment: Defines Scheduling Request (SR) physical resources. This field is valid a) if pucchFormat is 1, b) if pucchFormat is 1a, 1b or 1b with channel selection and the srHarqAckCombined flag is true, c) if pucchFormat is 2, 2a or 2b and the simulSrAndCqi flag is true. The parameter maximum range depends on maximum number of PUCCH PRBs. This depends on many PhyCell parameters.
member.name: resourceIndexSr

member.comment: Defines CQI physical resources. This field is valid only with formats 2, 2a and 2b, as well as with format 1b with channel selection. The maximum parameter range comes from PhyCell nCqiRb parameter range multiplied by 12. This limits the maximum number of index to 288 when all cyclic shifts are allowed. If pucchFormat is format 1b with channel selection the field is valid only if both this field and resourceIndexAn are not set to PHY_INVALID_VALUE.. If PHY finds a valid value of the field with format 1b with channel selection it will detect whether UE transmitted CQI + HARQ-ACK of PCell on resourceIndexCqi or HARQ-ACK of PCell&SCell.
member.name: resourceIndexCqi

member.comment: TDD specific parameter. Frequency offset information of candidate subcell.
member.name: frequencyOffsetInfoCandiSubCell

member.comment: Information for UE’s SCell.
member.name: sCellInfo

struct.name: SPucchUeReceiveRespD

member.comment: CRNTI packed in 16-bit field.
member.name: crnti

member.comment: For PCell, PHY shall set this field to the value of ueIndex from the request. For SCell, PHY shall set this field to the value of ueIndexSCell from the request. For SCell, In case ueIndexSCell = UE_INDEX_INVALID, PHY shall set this field to the value of ueIndex from the request and shall set 1st MSB to 1.
member.name: ueIndex

member.comment: PUCCH format copied from the request.
member.name: pucchFormat

member.comment: Result of HARQ-ACK reception. In FDD, PHY shall set this field to EDlHarqAckResult_Nack_Dtx only if all received HARQ-ACK bits for the serving cell are decoded as NACK/DTX.
member.name: harqAckResult

member.comment:
In FDD and TDD except pucchFormat == EPucchFormat_1b_CS: Decoded DL HARQ-ACK bits for the serving cell identified by ueIndex (1 or 2) HARQ-ACK bit 0 is in bit position 0 and HARQ-ACK bit 1 is in bit position 1 when count is started from LSB. Bit value 1 means positive acknowledgement (ACK) and bit value 0 stands for negative acknowledgement (NACK).
Decoded 1 or 2 bit DL HARQ-ACK result, which is sent by UE to uplink. In FDD: If pucchFormat == EPucchFormat_1b_CS then 4MSBs are used to indicate the number of reported HARQ ACK bits. For example, if harqAckBits is 0x21 it means PHY reports 2-bit HARQ ACK with the decoded bit values equal to “01”. Note. When spatially-bundled HARQ-ACK is received on SR PUCCH resource, PHY shall “unbundle” them and report originally requested number of bits per cell. In TDD: If pucchFormat == EPucchFormat_1b_CS then each 2 bits are used to indicate one HARQ ACK bit in one cell from LSB Note. When spatially-bundled HARQ-ACK is received on SR PUCCH resource, PHY shall “unbundle” them and report requested number of bits per cell as the same as received on AN PUCCH resource.
member.name: harqAckBits

member.comment: Quality / Reliability of CQI. DTX means that a valid CQI was not detected; TX means that a valid CQI was detected. NotAttempted means that PHY did not detect UE CQI transmission in case simulSrAndCqi = TRUE. ECqiQualityResult_CrcFailed is not valid in case of PUCCH.
member.name: cqiQualityResult

member.comment: CQI bits for the relevant serving cell. The maximum number of CQI bits is 11 bits. Bits are put into cqiBits word as MSB bit first order, meaning that CQI bit zero as 3GPP numbering goes into MSB bit (bit 31) into the cqiBits word. CQI bit 10 goes into bit number 21. The value of unused bits in the cqiBits word are undefined and bits should not be used.

PHY makes PUCCH TA measurements only when UE transmissions are according to format 2,2a,2b; in other cases PHY sets both phiReal and phiImag to 0.
member.name: phiReal

member.comment: The imaginary part of Phi estimate for Timing Advance (TA) measurements. PHY sets both phiImag and phiReal to 0 if the TA measurements are not reliable. PHY makes PUCCH TA measurements only when UE transmissions are according to format 2,2a,2b; in other cases PHY sets both phiReal and phiImag to 0.
member.name: phiImag

member.comment: Array of complex channel coefficients calculated by PUCCH channel estimator for the 1st slot of the subframe. Each element represents one value for one antenna. MAC uses the values in Doppler frequency estimation. Array contains valid elements only if pucchFormat is 2. The values in the array are valid only when number of the Antennas per cell is equal to 2
member.name: fdChannelEstSlot0

member.comment: Array of complex channel coefficients calculated by PUCCH channel estimator for the 2nd slot of the subframe. Each element represents one value for one antenna. MAC uses the values in Doppler frequency estimation. Array contains valid elements only if pucchFormat is 2. The values in the array are valid only when number of the Antennas per cell is equal to 2
member.name: fdChannelEstSlot1

struct.comment: The PUCCH measurement structure contains Total power (S+I+N) and Interference power (I + N) of one PRB for one slot for all antenna branches.
struct.name: SPucchPrbMeasurement

member.comment: PUCCH total power (S+I+N) in one PRB of the slot is measured separately from all diversity antennas and summed over the antennas. The measured total power contains power of all PUCCH UEs (S) allocated in the PRB of the slot and interference + noise power components (I+N).
member.name: totalPower

member.comment: Interfence power (I + N) in one PRB of the slot is measured separately from all diversity antennas and averaged over the antennas. All power which is not PUCCH signal power (S) is interpreted as interference. The interference power contains also noise power. Note. UL PHY does not yet support the measurements for the PRBs where format 1ab UEs are mixed with format 2ab UEs.
member.name: interferencePower

member.comment: Defines the resource configation for which the total capacity values are provided
member.name: resourceConfiguration

member.comment: Defines the total processing load limit per subframe per cell for UEs with PUCCH CQI and PUCCH SR. PHY will not be overloaded only if the following condition is satisfied in every subframe of the cell: srUeLoad*N_sr + cqiUeLoad*N_cqi < totalSrCqiCapacity. N_sr and N_cqi are the number of PUCCH CQI UEs and the number of PUCCH SR UEs in the subframe of the cell, respectively.
member.name: totalSrCqiCapacity

member.comment: Defines the total processing load limit per subframe per cell for UEs with SRS. PHY will not be overloaded only if the following condition is satisfied in every subframe of the cell: SUM_OVER_SRS_UEs_IN_SUBFRAME_OF_CELL(srsPrbLoad*n + srsUeOverheadLoad) < totalSrsCapacity. n is the number of SRS resource elements containing SRS signal of a specific UE.
member.name: totalSrsCapacity

If cqiSizeRi2=RESET_RI_TABLE, PHY shall reset the RI table to 0 in case periodic RI is not detected for the relevant UE’s serving cell. For TDD, PTI shall also be reset with value 0.

member.comment: Quality of CQI. DTX means that PUSCH transmission was detected as unreliable; TX means that CQI was received; CRC FAILED means that CQI CRC check of convolutional decoder failed even CQI was received.
member.name: cqiQualityResult

member.comment: CQI bits for the serving cell identified by ueIndex that are packed into cqiBits table starting from word index 0. Bits are put into words as MSB bit first order meaning that CQI bit zero as 3GPP numbering goes to MSB bit (bit 31) to the word index zero. CQI bit 31 goes into LSB bit (bit 0) of word index zero. CQI bit 32 goes to MSB bit of word index 1. The procedure is continued as long as there are bits in the CQI word. The value of unused bits in the cqiBits table is undefined and should not be used.
member.name: cqiBits

member.comment: Pointer to the Transport Block (TB) memory. In case MAC allocates the TB memory this pointer is same as in PHY_PuschReceiveReq. In case LTE UL PHY allocates the TB memory it uses AaMem (AaMem Pool ID is EAaMemLteDspPoolIdShared_PhyDataUplink defined in LTE_ENV) and gives this pointer and ownership to LTE MAC with PHY_PuschReceiveRespU message. If LTE UL PHY cannot create or send the message, it must release any already-allocated memory by itself. For all received PHY_PuschReceiveRespU messages, LTE MAC is responsible for releasing the TB memory. If MAC allocated the TB memory in the Req and If CRC failed the TB data is not valid in the TB memory. If MAC did not allocate the TB memory in the Req and if CRC failed, then UL PHY shall not allocate the TB memory and shall set this pointer to zero. Data bits are packed as big endian MSB first mode as the following way. Data bits are packed into memory starting from byte index 0. Bits are put into bytes as MSB bit first order meaning that data bit zero goes to MSB bit (bit 7) to the byte index zero. Data bit seven goes into LSB bit (bit 0) of byte index zero. Data bit 8 goes to MSB bit of byte index 1. The procedure is continued as long as there are data bits. In case of FSMr3b this tbPointer does not contain any valid data.
member.name: tbPointer

member.comment: Copied from the request message.
member.name: ueContextFlags

member.comment: This field is ignored in TDD. HARQ transmission counter, including initial transmission and retransmissions. HARQ transmission counter value is coded into bits 0..6 (LSB) with the allowed values range [1..127]. UL PHY shall set HARQ transmission counter to 1 in case of initial transmission or in exception cases. UL PHY shall increment the HARQ transmission counter for every HARQ retransmission. In TTI bundling, for every HARQ retransmission, UL PHY shall increment the HARQ transmission counter only for the last TTI of the bundle. UL PHY shall set MSB of the field to 1 only if the UE is in TTI bundling mode, else it is 0.
member.name: txCount

member.comment: The PRB measurement table contains PUSCH PRB specific measurement structures for all PRBs in whole system band. The table size depends on system bandwidth. For example 10 MHz cell the table size is 50 PRB measurement structures. Every PRB contains measurement value even it has not been allocated for PUSCH. PRBs which has not been allocated for PUSCH all power is interpreted as interference power and signal power is zero. For TDD, if numOfSubCell is 0, table size is numberOfLayers*PRB number corresponding to bandwidth. if numOfSubCell larger than 0, table size is numOfSubCell*numOfLayers*PRB number corresponding to bandwidth. The values in the table should be filled in sequence of PRB, layer and subcell. The sequence of subcell is defined in subCellId array.
member.name: puschPrbMeasurement

member.comment: Array of the PUCCH measurement structures. Each PUCCH measurement structure contains the measurements calculated for one PRB for every slot. The array is ordered according to "m" value. The variable "m" is described in 3GPP 36.211 figure 5.4.3-1. In particular, the structures in the array are ordered as follows: [1st slot with m=m0, 2nd slot for m=m0, 1st slot with m=m0+1, 2nd slot for m=m0+1, ..., 1st slot with m=m0+pucchResourceSize, 2nd slot for m=m0+pucchResourceSize], where m0 = blankedPucch. The array size pucchResourceSize is calculated during the cell setup depending on the PUCCH configuration parameters nCqiRb, n1PucchAn, deltaPucchShift, pucchNAnCs, and blankedPucch. For PRBs, which have not been allocated for PUCCH reception, power is interpreted as interference power and signal power is zero. For TDD, the values in the table should be filled in sequence of PRB then subcell. The sequence of subcell is defined in subCellId array.
member.name: pucchPrbMeasurement

struct.comment: Dynamic message part of PHY_SrsReceiveRespU that contains 1) variable size array of UE parameters (ueResp) 2) payload attached at the end of the message. Payload is the variable size array of RSSI values (array of TRssi) for all UEs included in the message; numOfSrsMeas is the actual number of array elements reported in the message; TRssi defines the array element format. The RSSI measurements for one UE are continuous inside the payload and are ordered according to increasing PRB number. Different UEs in the payload are ordered according to the order of UEs in ueResp. To locate the first RSSI measurement value in the payload for each UE, PHY reports the payloadOffset parameter in SSrsUeReceiveRespU for every UE. For example, if UE's srsBandWidth is 96 and UE's index in ueResp array is 20 then PHY will report 96/4 = 24 RSSI values for this UE and put them to the payload array in increasing PRB number order right after the measurements for 20 other UEs preceding this UE in ueResp. PHY reports the offset parameter in the payload for this UE in ueResp[20].payloadOffset.
struct.name: SSrsReceiveRespU

struct.comment: Structure that contains UE’s SCell related information.
struct.name: SSCellInfo

member.comment:
In FDD, 4 LSBs is the PCell nibble and indicate the number of HARQ ACK bits with the unscheduling flag in the highest bit of the nibble. 4 MSBs is the corresponding SCell nibble. In PUSCH, PHY shall not report decoded HARQ-ACK back to MAC for the cell with the unscheduling flag set to 1. In PUCCH, MAC shall keep the flags unset for both PCell and SCell.
Example 1. harqAckSize = 0xa2. PCell: Num of AN bits is 2, unsheduling flag is unset. SCell: Num of AN bits is 2, unsheduling flag is set. PHY shall not report AN for SCell. In TDD, 4 LSBs is the PCell nibble and indicate the number of HARQ ACK bits when m=1 for HARQ on PUCCH or W=1 for HARQ on PUSCH. See 3GPP TS 36.213 V10.8. 4 MSBs is the corresponding SCell nibble. Note, there is no unscheduling flag for TDD.
member.name: harqAckSize

This parameter value is not supported and is for future development for LRC. Note: Parameter shall also be set to zero if it is not valid or if UE has single serving cell.

member.comment: Pointer to a memory block reserved on PHY TX for the dynamic part of the PHY_PdcchSendReq and PHY_PhichSendReq messages for the cell to be used for SRIO NWRITE data transfer. The address is aligned on a double word (64-bit) boundary with reference to a datablock to transfer the dynamic part of the messages for 2 consecutive TTIs on the cell (data for 2 PdcchSendReq messages and 2 PhichSendReq messages). The memory is organized to address memoryblocks of structures SPdcchSendReqBuffer and SphichSendReqBuffer aligned on double word (64-bit) boundary. The total blocksize depends on the configured bandwidth and on mode (FDD/TDD), e.g the variable parts of the structures numOfDci/numOfPhichInfo are limited to the maximum values supported for the configuration. For detailed information see textual part of this document.
member.name: requestCtrlMsgBufferCw0

member.comment: Pointer to a memory block reserved on PHY TX for the dynamic part of the PHY_PdcchSendReq if message is needed on second address. Alignment and calculatio of buffersize is same as for requestCtrlMsgBufferCw0 but will include just memory for the SPdcchSendReqBuffers.
member.name: requestCtrlMsgBufferCw1

message.comment: Coding information for PDCCH and PCFICH in TTI specified by (sfn.eSfn). The PCFICH will be generated according to the CFI value provided in this message. A PHY_PdcchSendReq is expected in every TTI, since it required for generating PCFICH. In case no DCI is available, MAC shall set numOfDCI=0. Client must send this message to the address which is specified in the pdcchCw0SendReqAddress field of the PHY_DlPhyDataAddressResp message. It should additionally sent it to the address specified in the field pdcchCw1SendReqAddress of the PHY_DlPhyDataAddressResp under certain conditions; for details, see PHY_DlPhyDataAddressResp. All PDCCH shall be aggregated for one TTI and shall be included in one single pdcchSendReq.
message.name: PHY_PdcchSendReq

If SysCom over SRIO is used requestCtrlMsgBuffer has to be set to 0 and complete message has to be transferred within the send request message.

Client must send this message to the address which is specified in the pdschCw0SendReqAddress field (for code word #0) and pdschCw1ReceiverAddress field (for code word #1) of the PHY_DlPhyDataAddressResp message. If the payload is appended to the message the total message size including the SysCom message header must not exceed 256 bytes.

member.comment: All beamforming specific parameters in PdschSendReq message. This IE exist or not depending on numOfDlBfPdsch. When numOfDlBfPdsch is set 0: message hasn’t dlBfPdsch. 1: message has dlBfPdsch. numOfDlBfPdsch is set to 1 only when UE SDlTbFormat spatialMode is set with the following values: ESpatialMode_SingleStreamBF, ESpatialMode_TM8_Port7, ESpatialMode_TM8_Port8, ESpatialMode_TM8_Port78, ESpatialMode_TM9_Port7, ESpatialMode_TM9_Port8, ESpatialMode_TM9_UpTo8LayersTx. Note: If payload is appended after msg directly the variable msg length has to be considered! This means for FDD the payload has to start after IE numOfDlBfPdsch, whereas for TDD after the variable length array!
member.name: dlBfPdsch

message.comment: Client must send this message to the address which is specified in the puschReceiverAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddressResp message. The message contains PUSCH receiving request from MAC to PHY for defined TTI. All UEs in one TTI per one cell are grouped into one request message. The dynamic message part is the variable size structure SPuschReceiveReq + optional variable size structure SSCellAddressingInfo. SSCellAddressingInfo structure is included at the end of the message if message.numOfSCellAddressingInfo is more than 0.
message.name: PHY_PuschReceiveReq

member.name: message

message.comment: PHY must send this message to the address which is specified in the puschReceiveRespDAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddress message. The message contains HARQ-ACK related information for corresponding PuschReceiveRequest message. All UEs in one TTI per one cell are grouped into one message. Message size including syscom header must be less than 256 bytes.
message.name: PHY_PuschReceiveRespD

message.comment: PHY must send this message to the address which is specified in the puschReceiveCqiRespDAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddress message. Message contains CQI related information as a reponse for PHY_PuschReceiveReq message. PHY may arbitrarily divide UEs from the same cell and the same TTI into up to 4 groups. Each UE group will be reported to MAC in the separate PHY_PuschReceiveCqiRespD message. Dynamic message part is the variable size structure SPuschReceiveCqiRespD. The number of reported UEs #UEs in the message is calculated as #UEs = header.buffer.bSize/size_in_bytes_of(SPuschReceiveCqiRespD) In FSMr3, all UEs from the same cell and the same TTI will be reported in the single message.
message.name: PHY_PuschReceiveCqiRespD

member.comment: Static message header that contains addressing info of the dynamic message part.
member.name: header

member.comment: Dynamic message part. Sender must exclude this from the message if the Negotiation-Less Req-Resp Pattern is used (header.buffer.bAddress is not 0).
member.name: message

message.comment:
In FSMr2: PHY must send this message to the address, which is specified in the puschReceiveRespUAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddressReq message. In FSMr3: PHY must send this message to the UE group specific address defined for every UE by puschReceiveRespUAddress[“uegroupindex”], where “uegroupindex” is the UE group derived from the UE’s ueIndex. Only for FSMr3: the message contains the actual transport block data of one user after the array of the SPuschUeResp. Notice that 'numOfUePuschResp' is always '1' for FSMr3.
Severall UEs in one TTI from different cells may be grouped into one message. The response message delivery order is not necessarily the same as order of UE structures in the request message.
message.name: PHY_PuschReceiveRespU

member.name: frameNumber

member.comment: If TRUE (1) the message is the last one to be expected for the Ue Group in this TTI. Contains valid value only when the sending and receiving entity are on the same DSP (i.e. SRIO not used).
member.name: lastMsgInTti

member.comment: Total number of PHY_PuschReceiveRespUs expected by MAC in TTI for the relevant UE group. In FSMr3: A proper value is given in each PHY_PuschReceiveRespU. In FSMr2: A proper value is given in the last PHY_PuschReceiveRespU per TTI. Any other messages may carry value 0 indicating that the parameter is invalid and shall be ignored by MAC.
member.name: numOfRespUsInTti

This message is the response to PHY_PuschReceiveReq that is used to report cell based PUSCH measurements for a given TTI. message.comment: Client must send this message to the address which is specified in the pucchReceiverAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddressResp message. The message contains PUCCH receiving request from MAC to PHY for defined TTI. The message contains all UEs which are scheduled in the same sub frame of the same cell. Dynamic message part is the variable size structure SPucchReceiveReq + optional variable size structure SSCellAddressingInfo. SSCellAddressingInfo structure is included at the end of the message if message.numOfSCellAddressingInfo is more than 0.

message.comment: PHY must send this message to the address which is specified in the pucchReceiveRespDAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddressReq message. The message contains HARQ-ACK related information of all UEs which have been scheduled in the same sub frame of the same cell. This means that there are as many response messages per sub frame as there are cells, which contains at least one scheduled UE with HARQ-ACK reception. Message size including syscom header must be less than 256 bytes.

message.comment: This message is not used in FDD. PHY must send this message to the address which is specified in the srsReceiveRespDAddress field of the PHY_UlPhyDataAddressReq message. The message contains all UEs which have SRS reception in the same sub frame of the same cell. This message is sent only if there is at least one UE to whom TA measurements were asked in the SRS receive request. Because timing advance measurement is not supported for SRS in increment 17 this message is not used in inc 17.

message.comment: If the PuschReceiveReq message parameters are corrupted (for example non existing cell id) or message is not received in right time window, UL PHY is not able to generate standard response messages. In this case UL PHY sends only PHY_PuschReceiveRejectedResp message. Not that any other response messages defined in the chapter 3.3.1 are not sent.
message.name: PHY_PuschReceiveRejectedResp

member.comment: Cell identification copied from the req message. In case this field is corrupted, PHY shall set this to PHY_INVALID_VALUE
member.name: lnCelId

member.comment: LTE radio frame number copied from the req message. In case this field is corrupted, PHY shall set this to PHY_INVALID_VALUE
member.name: frameNumber

member.comment: LTE radio sub frame number copied from the req message. In case this field is corrupted, PHY shall set this to PHY_INVALID_VALUE
member.name: subFrameNumber

member.comment: The specificCause field tells what is wrong with the rejected message. The following causes are used: - ESpecificCauseLte_PHY_UnknownCellId Cell does not exist - ESpecificCauseLte_PHY_InvalidParam Some other invalid parameter - ESpecificCauseLte_PHY_UnexpectedMessage Receiver is not ready to process the request or request already received for the same sub frame - ESpecificCauseLte_PHY_DeadlineMissed request was not received in a valid time window - ESpecificCauseLte_PHY_Unspecified some other reason
member.name: specificCause
